com.marsG.simplerandomorglib

Class RandomIntegerClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.marsG.simplerandomorglib.RandomIntegerClient

  • public final class RandomIntegerClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple Http client to facilitate getting random integers, in binary, hexadecimal, octal or decimal form, generated by 'random.org' website.(http://www.random.org) Please set userClient field to your e-mail address, so Dr.Haar can contact you in case this client misbehaves. The minimum value must be an integer in the [-1000000000,1000000000] interval The maximum value must be an integer in the [-1000000000,1000000000] interval The number of integers to be generated must be an integer in the [1,10000] interval Quota: RANDOM.ORG uses a simple quota system to make sure nobody hogs all the random numbers produced by the generator. If your current allowance is below 0, this client will throw NotEnoughQuotaException. Please check http://www.random.org/quota/ for further details.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Mars Gokturk

      • getRandomIntDecimal

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRandomIntDecimal(int the_min,
                                                   int the_max,
                                                   int the_numOfRandomInts)
                                                     throws org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException,
                                                            java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        the_min - The minimum value must be an integer in the [-1000000000,1000000000] interval
        the_max - The maximum value must be an integer in the [-1000000000,1000000000] interval
        the_numOfRandomInts - The number of integers to be generated must be an integer in the [1,10000] interval
        Returns:
        list of integers(base 10) in the [the_min,the_max] interval with size of the_numOfRandomInts.
        Throws:
        org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when given arguments are not in acceptable range.
        NotEnoughQuotaException - when the client has exceeded its quota.
